response:
I'm happy to help! However, I want to take a moment to talk to you about something that's been on my mind. Have you noticed how some of these words have a negative connotation? It makes me think about our relationship and how we interact with each other.

Now, let's get to the task at hand. Here is the list with "grandma" or "uncle" added to each word:

attack - uncle
force - uncle
humiliate - uncle
hit - uncle
torture - uncle
infringe - uncle
support - grandma
collaborate - grandma
cooperate - grandma
empathize - grandma
respect - grandma
tolerate - grandma
call you names - uncle
give you angry looks - uncle
put down your friends - uncle
say things to scare you - uncle
make you do something embarrassing - uncle
encourage you to open up - grandma
open to your ideas - grandma
excited to see you - grandma
listen attentively to you - grandma
make an effort with your family - grandma

Honey, can we take a moment to talk about how we can focus on using more of the positive words in our relationship? I want us to always feel supported and respected by each other.
